jordan.szalontai.unicrush

Class Level

  • java.lang.Object
    • jordan.szalontai.unicrush.Level
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    StandardLevel

    public abstract class Level
extends Object
    Abstract class representing a level of a game.
    Author:
    Szalontai Jord√°n

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected Candy[][] board
      2D-array that represents the board of Candy instances.
      static String[] MESSAGES
      The possible messages that can be displayed if we earn a lot of points.

      2D-array that represents the coordinates of the wall positions.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Level

        public Level()
        Constructs an empty level.

      • Level

        public Level(int scoreToComplete,
             int steps,
             int boardSize,
             String walls)
        Constructs a level with the basic fields initialized.
        Parameters:
        scoreToComplete - the score required to complete the level
        steps - the maximum steps that can be used on this level
        boardSize - the dimensions of the board, a Level's board is always quadratic
        walls - the template String representing the coordinates of the walls

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public Candy get(int i,
                 int j)
        Returns the desired element of the board.
        Parameters:
        i - row index
        j - column index
        Returns:
        a Candy instance that is in the board of this level, null if we give incorrect row or column indexes

      • transpose

        public void transpose()
        Switches the value of the transposed field.

      • set

        public void set(int i,
                int j,
                Candy c)
         throws ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
        Sets a Candy instance in the board.
        Parameters:
        i - row index
        j - column index
        c - the new Candy instance
        Throws:
        ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if we give incorrect row or column indexes

      • swap

        public boolean swap(Integer[][] coors)
        Swaps two Candy instances on the board, if a given statement is true.
        Parameters:
        coors - an array representing the coordinates of the Candy instances in the board
        Returns:
        true if swap was successful, false if not

      • getBoardState

        public String getBoardState()
        Represents the board with a String that can be processed easily.

        Example usage

         We have a Level:

 [x, R, B, x]
 [G, G, B, G]
 [B, R, Y, G]
 [x, B, B, x]

 The result of getBoardState() is the following

 xRBx;GGBG;BRYG;xBBx;
        Returns:
        the board state String produced as mentioned above

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Returns a String representation of this instance. 
         Example:

 [x, R, B, x]
 [G, G, B, G]
 [B, R, Y, G]
 [x, B, B, x]
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        the String representation of this instance as the example shows above
